verses.text: In those days there was no king in Israel. And in those days the tribe of the Danites was seeking a territory to live in, for until that time no inheritance among the tribes of Israel had been given to them.
verses.comment: Verse clarifies Dan's lack of allotted territory; translation closely follows the Hebrew.

verses.text: So the people of Dan sent five men from their clan, men of valor, from Zorah and Eshtaol, to spy out the land and explore it. They said to them, 'Go, explore the land.' So they came to the hill country of Ephraim, to the house of Micah, and spent the night there.
verses.comment: “Men of valor” is a term for capable warriors.

verses.text: When they were near Micah's house, they recognized the voice of the young Levite. So they turned aside and said to him, 'Who brought you here? What are you doing in this place? What is your business here?'
verses.comment: The “voice” likely refers to his dialect/accent.

verses.text: He said to them, 'Micah has done such and such for me, and he has hired me, and I have become his priest.'
verses.comment: Levite confirms his employment by Micah as priest.

verses.text: And they said to him, 'Please inquire of God, so that we may know whether our journey will be successful.'
verses.comment: Request for divine guidance by consultation of priest.

verses.text: The priest said to them, 'Go in peace. The journey you are on is under the Lord’s approval.'
verses.comment: Priest assures them of God's favor.

verses.text: So the five men departed and came to Laish. There they saw the people living in security, after the manner of the Sidonians, quiet and unsuspecting, lacking nothing in their land and possessing wealth. They were far from the Sidonians and had no dealings with anyone.
verses.comment: Describes Laish as isolated and prosperous, like Sidonians.

verses.text: When they came back to their brothers at Zorah and Eshtaol, their brothers asked them, 'What do you report?'
verses.comment: Return of the spies to deliver their report.

verses.text: They said, 'Arise, let us go up against them. For we have seen the land, and it is very good. Will you do nothing? Do not hesitate to go, enter, and possess the land.'
verses.comment: Encouragement to take possession of Laish.

verses.text: When you go, you will come to a peaceful people and a land that is spacious. God has given it into your hands—a place where there is no lack of anything that is on the earth.'
verses.comment: Assurance of easy conquest and provision.

verses.text: So six hundred men from the tribe of Dan, armed with weapons of war, left Zorah and Eshtaol.
verses.comment: Danite fighting force prepares for campaign.

verses.text: They went up and camped at Kiriath-jearim in Judah. Therefore the place is called Mahaneh Dan to this day; it is west of Kiriath-jearim.
verses.comment: Mahaneh Dan means “Camp of Dan.”

verses.text: From there they passed on to the hill country of Ephraim and came to Micah's house.
verses.comment: Danites approach Micah's house again.

verses.text: Then the five men who had gone to spy out the land of Laish said to their brothers, 'Do you know that in these houses there are an ephod, household gods, a carved image, and a metal image? Now consider what you will do.'
verses.comment: Objects refer to Micah's illicit shrine and idols.

verses.text: So they turned aside and came to the house of the young Levite, at Micah’s home, and greeted him.
verses.comment: Danites greet the Levite priest.

verses.text: Now six hundred men, armed with weapons of war, stood at the entrance of the gate.
verses.comment: Shows readiness for possible conflict or intimidation.

verses.text: The five men who had gone to spy out the land entered and took the carved image, the ephod, the household gods, and the metal image, while the priest stood at the entrance of the gate with the six hundred men armed with weapons.
verses.comment: Danites seize Micah’s religious artifacts.

verses.text: When these men went into Micah’s house and took the carved image, the ephod, the household gods, and the metal image, the priest said to them, 'What are you doing?'
verses.comment: Priest questions their actions as items are seized.

verses.text: They said to him, 'Be quiet. Put your hand over your mouth and come with us, and be to us a father and a priest. Is it better for you to be priest to the house of one man, or to be priest to a tribe and clan in Israel?'
verses.comment: Danites recruit the priest for their tribe, offering more prestige.

verses.text: The priest’s heart was glad. He took the ephod, the household gods, and the carved image, and went along with the people.
verses.comment: Priest willingly joins Danites, accepting their offer.

verses.text: Turning and departing, they placed the little ones, the livestock, and the goods in front of them.
verses.comment: Standard caravan formation for protection.

verses.text: When they were a good distance from Micah's house, the men who were in the houses near Micah’s house gathered together and overtook the sons of Dan.
verses.comment: Micah and neighbors pursue after Danites.

verses.text: They called out to the sons of Dan, who turned around and said to Micah, 'What is the matter with you, that you have come with such a company?'
verses.comment: Danites react to pursuit and confrontation.

verses.text: He said, 'You took away my gods that I made, and the priest, and have gone away, and what do I have left? How then can you say to me,
verses.comment: Micah complains that his household religion is stolen; his sense of loss is emphasized in the original.

verses.text: And the sons of Dan said to him, 'Do not let your voice be heard among us, or angry men will attack you, and you will lose your life and the lives of your household.'
verses.comment: Danites threaten violence if Micah persists.

verses.text: Then Micah, seeing that they were too strong for him, turned and went back to his home.
verses.comment: Defeated and outnumbered, Micah retreats.

verses.text: But the sons of Dan took what Micah had made, and the priest who belonged to him, and came to Laish, to a quiet and unsuspecting people. They struck them with the sword and burned the city with fire.
verses.comment: Complete conquest—Danites destroy Laish and its inhabitants.

verses.text: There was no one to rescue them because the city was far from Sidon, and they had no dealings with anyone. It was in the valley that belongs to Beth-rehob. They rebuilt the city and lived in it.
verses.comment: City’s isolation explains its vulnerability; Danites settle there.

verses.text: They called the city Dan after the name of Dan, their ancestor, who was born to Israel; but the name of the city was Laish at first.
verses.comment: Name change signifies tribal possession.

verses.text: The sons of Dan set up the carved image for themselves, and Jonathan, the son of Gershom, son of Moses, and his sons were priests to the tribe of Dan until the day of the captivity of the land.
verses.comment: Some manuscripts read 'Manasseh' instead of 'Moses'. The reference to captivity is debated as to which captivity is meant.

verses.text: So they set up for themselves Micah’s carved image, which he made, all the days that the house of God was in Shiloh.
verses.comment: “House of God at Shiloh” refers to the worship center in Israel; indicates Dan's rival cult persisted long afterwards.
